data.meta_description: Penacony, also known as the "Planet of Festivities", is a planet currently administered by The Family in the Asdana star system. It is the fourth world and can be accessed after completing the Trailblaze Mission Long Day's Journey Into Night in the Chapter The Sound and the Fury. The Trailblaze...
data.text:
OverviewHistory

A colossal structure located in the Asdana system, with the soaring hotel "The Reverie" as its iconic landmark. Once a frontier prison belonging to the IPC, The Family had modeled it to serve as an interstellar transportation hub and the gateway to the Sweetdream Paradise.

Penacony, also known as the "Planet of Festivities", is a planet currently administered by The Family in the Asdana star system.

It is the fourth world and can be accessed after completing the Trailblaze Mission Long Day's Journey Into Night in the Chapter The Sound and the Fury.

The Trailblaze Mission chapters The Sound and the Fury, Cat Among Pigeons, In Our Time and Farewell, Penacony take place in this world.

Overview[]

Geography[]

Reality[]

Although called the "Planet of Festivities", the actual physical structure of Penacony in reality is that of a colossal artificial space station-like megastructure which houses The Reverie Hotel, surrounded by two small Alderson disks orbiting it. The alderson disks have several landmasses and bodies of water, which were said to be once barren deserts.[1]

City buildings can be seen jutting out on both from the "top" and "underside" of the alderson disks. Charmony Doves are a species of bird that inhabit Penacony. Penacony is located in the Asdana, a star system brimming with memoria, which has historically been one of the Macro Voids that leaked out from the Memory Zone. The memoria concentration surrounding Penacony is above normal levels.[2][3]

Dreamscape[]

Penacony's Dreamscape is divided into twelve main discrete dream worlds, each corresponding to a "moment" on the clock:

Moment of Midnight, the starting point of all dreams.[4]

Moment of Serenity, when the first ray of sunlight shines over the horizon.[4]

Moment of Morning Dew, the start of a day.[4]

Moment of Daybreak, presumably based on the early morning.[4]

Moment of Gilded Hour, presumably the moment before noon.[4]

Moment of Sol, the moment that strikes noon.[4]

Moment of Oasis, presumably afternoon.[4]

Moment of Scorchsand, presumably the moment before dusk.[4]

Moment of Dusk, presumably dusk.

Moment of Blue Hour, presumably the moment after dusk.[4]

Moment of Stars, based on the 11th hour of the clock.[5]

Moment of Golden Hour, based on the moment before midnight.[6]

Golden Hour is said to be the most prosperous "Moment" in Penacony, showcasing an entire city bathed in luxury and is the location of the Penacony Grand Theater. Morning Dew is where the majestic Dewlight Pavilion stands, providing a place for high-level members of the Oak Family to discuss business and is where one would go to meet the Family. Scorchsand has vast fields, wild winds, taverns, and a "festive choice" of venue. It also hosts the SoulGlad™ Scorchsand Audition Venue. Dusk is said to be a shopping paradise of chic, luxury and consumerism, and includes the Penacony Auction Hall among other places.[7][8] Sol is steeped in Penacony's history and civilization and contain's Penacony's Grand Museum, the Primal Waking Library and the Paperfold Academy.[6] Serenity is said to be where the most terrifying convicts and "interesting people" are held and the jail can be seen on the Nightmare's edge.[9][10] Daybreak is where the Dawn Factory is located, one of the many "imagination factories" which processes the foundation of the dreamscape and where workers create all kinds of whimsical works day in and day out in their dreams such as garments.

Gilded Hour is Penacony's Currency Center where the exquisitely dressed Pepeshi people of the Alfalfa Family keep fortress-like financial city that is the economic heart of Penacony running, always in a hurry to deposit the Alfalfa credits that they earned into the bank's vault and sending blood that is made from money everywhere on Penacony. Blue Hour is said to be very romantic, featuring a dock, a large boat called the "Eventide" anchored along the Sea of Dreams where extravagant balls and marriage services are organized, and an airship called the Radiant Feldspar that sails through all dreamscapes.[11][12][13] Oasis has natural scenes such as Sunshine Park and a beach while Stars has an amusement park, clubs, casinos, and various competitions, including Spheroid, Roboball, and Unicycler.[5][14][15][16][17][8] The Moment of Midnight is the starting point of all dreams. People tend to overlook this moment, believing there's nothing beyond the inky darkness it presents. Chuckles and laughter can be heard from entering the dream.[4]

Areas[]

Reality[]

Dreamscape[]

Space Anchors[]

Reality[]

The Reverie (Reality)[]

There are 2 Space Anchors in The Reverie (Reality):

Name Image Description VIP Lounge A luxurious salon designed specially for VIPs. The most important guests from across the universe gather the tables, indulging in the most meticulous services available in reality. Hotel Lobby The lobby where hotel check-ins are handled and the first stop to arriving in the Dreamscape. People of all fashions and kinds congregate here, waiting to experience the most vivid dreams possible. Dream Side — The Ultimate Trailblazer's Guide to Penacony

Dreamscape[]

Golden Hour[]

There are 6 Space Anchors in Golden Hour:

Name Image Description Aideen Park An amusement park built with sponsorship from the soft drink brand "SoulGlad." Recreational facilities can be seen everywhere here, and guests can indulge in honeyed nectar and release their minds from thoughts outside the dream. Clockie Plaza An expansive central plaza. This area seems more leisurely than the crowded streets. A statue of the famous cartoon character "Clockie" towers in place here. Oti Mall The most bustling Commercial District in the Golden Hour, established by Old Oti, head of the Alfalfa Family. Pedestrians flow through here like a never-ending stream, and splendid lights imbue this place with a radiance comparable to that of day. Dreammerse Shopping Street Peppy Pepeshi's Salon is located in the area beneath the shopping center, where they serve their small and adorable kin with delectable nectar. The Reverie Hotel Entrance The plaza before the entrance to The Reverie. The magnificent dial stays halted and unmoving, while fountains erupt with golden syrup, reminding guests they dwell within the Dreamscape. Sweet Corner The path leading to the exit of Aideen Park. When you grow tired of the indulgent revelry in the center of the park, you can come to this corner of the streets for a moment of peace or a wondrous encounter.

Dream's Edge[]

There are 4 Space Anchors in Dream's Edge:

Name Image Description Front Observation Deck An observation deck where one has a sweeping view of the magnificence of the Golden Hour, and will be the generator of romantic memories for countless lovers in the foreseeable future. The Family's Construction Authority Members of The Family monitor and oversee the construction of a new city in the Dreamscape. It can be understood as the stakeholder's office. Dreamweaver Plaza A place where Dreamweavers can show off their capabilities — in physical terms. This is a place where artists and engineers can set off group brawls at any time when they disagree with each other. Rooftop Garden A rooftop garden with a nice view. It's obvious that Penacony's Dreamweavers have extreme obsessions when it comes to the heights of buildings.

A Child's Dream[]

There are 3 Space Anchors in A Child's Dream:

Name Image Description Clock Factory A thin slice cut from someone's memories. Now the stream no longer has a direction to flow, and the clock hands have long ceased to turn. Eddying Dreamscape Every fish in the schools that swim upstream along the river of memories represents an entirely unique past — until they are swallowed by the sea of oblivion and lose their shape. Corridor of Memories Very few people would have experienced the fantastical event of becoming entangled in another's memory. Even fewer are those who have found a way out of it.

The Reverie (Dreamscape)[]

There are 5 Space Anchors in The Reverie (Dreamscape):

Name Image Description Dreamjolt Hostelry An exquisitely decorated bar. The lightly relaxed atmosphere seems almost cheerless. It appears that the people being serviced here are no ordinary guests. Dreamscape Lobby A projection of the hotel lobby in the Dreamscape, already tainted by chaotic and disordered memoria. The Family established the single safe zone here. Monitoring Room A monitoring room in charge of tracking the conditions of guest rooms. Countless screens exist as if a wall of eyes. At present, their perceptions have all been obfuscated. VIP Lounge Corridor A corridor twisted by the Dreamscape, as winding and chaotic as a footpath leading to a secluded forest. Platinum Guest Room Hotel guest rooms in the Dreamscape. This is a necessary path to travel if one seeks to enter reality or other Moments.

Dewlight Pavilion[]

There are 2 Space Anchors in Dewlight Pavilion:

Name Image Description Reception Counter Dewlight Pavilion's reception hall. The receptionists are frequently loafing about due to the scarce visitors. Dreammaster Hall The spacious main hall of the residence. The leaders of the five major lineages regularly gather to discuss the situation and plan for the Dreamscape. A finely crafted city sandpit is placed at the center of the hall.

City Sandpit[]

There is 1 Space Anchor in City Sandpit:

Name Image Description City Sandpit A cityscape sandpit made in the image of Penacony with a 1:100 ratio to the real deal. It's easy to imagine a scene of the family heads using it to plan and make comments.

Clock Studios Theme Park[]

There are 4 Space Anchors in Clock Studios Theme Park:

Name Image Description Hanu Gang Base The park area with a Hanu Gang theme.

"Hmph?" Hamster Ball Park The park area with a Hamster Ball Knight theme.

"I am Hamster Ball Knight — the fastest rodent in the universe!" Screening Area Entrance The corridor leading to the film and television theme park's screening area is flanked by rest areas. To inquire about the current popular films and screening schedules, please consult members of The Family. Theme Park Entrance The entrance to the theme park. The cool Hamster Ball Knight and *the coolest* Hanu is just one chin-up away.

Dreamflux Reef[]

There are 5 Space Anchors in Dreamflux Reef:

Name Image Description Narrow Alley The first stop after getting off at the abandoned station. The Penacony Grand Theater symbolizing Harmony is the only source of light here. Timesplit Square This is where the Watchmaker set the foundations for the sweet dreams and where the monuments to the Nameless are erected. The towering buildings and the passing of time protect this secret site where dreams were born. Slumbertown A residential area in the realm of fleeting dreams. Dreamers who refuse to mingle with The Family hold firm to their homes here. Bygoneville The most deserted metropolis in Asdana. Only water-corroded skeletons remain of the bygone dreams' whalefall. A Child's Moonlight A tranquil garden. The full moon reflected in its waters seems almost within reach.

SoulGlad™ Scorchsand Audition Venue[]

There are 2 Space Anchors in SoulGlad™ Scorchsand Audition Venue:

Name Image Description Audition Plaza The plaza where the auditions begin and contestants gather. Ambitious individuals interact and share their experiences here while many journalists pace the grounds. Path of the Superstar The glittering path to superstardom that leads straight to the Grand Theater. When a victor arises among the participants, the giant SoulGlad bottle will erupt and celebrate the birth of the Festive Superstar.

Dreamplay Fantasia: Acting Challenge[]

There is 1 Space Anchor in Dreamplay Fantasia: Acting Challenge:

Name Image Description Dreamplay Fantasia: Acting Challenge A stage to test a performer's acting skills and performances. Sponsored by SoulGlad™.

Dreamplay Fantasia: Action Challenge[]

There is 1 Space Anchor in Dreamplay Fantasia: Action Challenge:

Name Image Description Dreamplay Fantasia: Action Challenge A duel area to test a performer's action prowess and action sequences. Sponsored by SoulGlad™.

Gunfire Time: Gunfire Trial[]

There is 1 Space Anchor in Gunfire Time: Gunfire Trial:

Name Image Description Gunfire Time: Gunfire Trial A highly-difficult stage themed after Brother Hanu. The stage's scenery faithfully recreates classical scenes from a certain Penaconian crime flick trilogy.

Gunfire Time: Time Trial[]

There are 2 Space Anchors in Gunfire Time: Time Trial:

Name Image Description Gunfire Time: Time Trial (Posterior) A highly-difficult stage themed after Clockie. Apparently, the organizers never fully obtained the right to use Clockie's image, so they had to replace him with a Dreamscape Ticker instead. Gunfire Time: Time Trial A highly-difficult stage themed after Clockie. Apparently, the organizers never fully obtained the right to use Clockie's image, so they had to replace him with a Dreamscape Ticker instead.

Superstar Showdown: Arena I[]

There is 1 Space Anchor in Superstar Showdown: Arena I:

Name Image Description Superstar Showdown: Arena I A stage that tests whether the participant possesses combat prowess worthy of the title of "Festive Superstar." For unknown reasons, the arenas were split into two. This is Arena I.

Superstar Showdown: Arena II[]

There is 1 Space Anchor in Superstar Showdown: Arena II:

Name Image Description Superstar Showdown: Arena II A stage that tests whether the participant possesses combat prowess worthy of the title of "Festive Superstar." For unknown reasons, the arenas were split into two. This is Arena II.

Penacony Grand Theater[]

There are 4 Space Anchors in Penacony Grand Theater:

Name Image Description Ascension Hallway The passage to the Penacony Grand Theater. The designers of the theater believe that members of The Family who pass through the hallway must receive an ascension of musical notes. Hall of Chords The main hall of the Penacony Grand Theater. The Chordmaster, representative of Harmony's hive mind, will descend here, hence its name. Saloon of Gospels A lounge for relaxation located just outside the VIP box on the second floor of the theater. Celebrities who long for Harmony's gospels exchange well-wishes in this place before heading to their boxes and receiving their graces. Communing Hall A multi-functional room and also a place for ladies and gentlemen to socialize. Every celebrity striving to emulate elegance is the sole protagonist of this farce.

Radiant Feldspar[]

There are 4 Space Anchors in Radiant Feldspar:

Name Image Description Cockpit The luxury airships within the Dreamscape have auto-navigation and autopilot capabilities. The cockpit is just for show. Midship Lounge Many deals were closed here by Old Oti. It is one of the few places to conduct proper business on board this airship. Main Banquet Hall The main banquet hall of the airship has hosted many moguls, aristocrats, and political dignitaries from various planets across the cosmos. Aft Pool A strange floral scent emanates from the swimming pool on the airship. The Alfalfa Family must have added something to the water. What's unexpected is that the fragrance seems to have attracted many Trotters that have lost their way in the Memory Zone.

Known Races[]

Humans

Halovians — Haloed humanoids

Pepeshi — Small humanoids

Intellitrons — Intelligent machines

Characters[]

Playable Characters[]

6 Characters match the category selection:

CharacterRarityPathCombat Type Black Swan Nihility Wind Boothill The Hunt Physical Gallagher Abundance Fire Misha Destruction Ice Robin Harmony Physical Sparkle Harmony Quantum

Upcoming Characters[]

NPCs[]

Related NPCs

There are 188 additional NPCs related to Penacony:

Mentioned Characters

There are 9 mentioned characters related to Penacony:

Upcoming NPCs

There are no upcoming NPCs related to Penacony.

Gallery[]

Trivia[]

Memory Bubble: Family contains the memory of a person who tried investigating the Family and hoped for an invitation to Penacony. A figure named Renoir is mentioned as a presumable member of the Family, although it is currently impossible to tell whether he might still be alive or not.

Etymology[]

The name "Penacony" comes from the phrase "penal colony."[18]

Other Languages[]

(Traditional)匹諾康尼JapaneseピノコニーKorean페나코니SpanishColonipenalFrenchPenaconyRussianПенаконияThaiPenaconyVietnamesePenaconyGermanPenaconyIndonesianPenaconyPortuguesePenacony
